channel.title: Developer Blog
channel.description: Keep down in writing developer problems and solutions

item.title: GitLab CI & Docker
item.description:
Problem description

Using Docker for GitLab’s CI-Runners on Windows

Try and failing hard!

docker run -d --name gitlab-runner --restart always -v /srv/gitlab-runner/config:/etc/gitlab-runner gitlab/gitlab-runner:latest docker run -d --name gitlab-runner --restart always -v D:/Coden/Workspaces/Docker/gitlab-runner/config:/etc/gitlab-runner gitlab/gitlab-runner:latest

docker run -d --name gitlab-runner --restart always -v /User/<User>/gitlab-runner/config:/etc/gitlab-runner gitlab/gitlab-runner:latest

docker run -d --name gitlab-runner-config -v /etc/gitlab-runner busybox:latest /bin/true docker run -d --name gitlab-runner --restart always --volumes-from gitlab-runner-config gitlab/gitlab-runner:latest
item.dc:creator: Andreas Gehle

item.title: How to create a HubPress post
item.description:
This article is about the syntax which is used to write posts via HubPress. HubPress’s syntax is based on AsciiDoc "a plain text documentation syntax and processor". Additionaly HubPress has extended this syntax: Hubpress Additional Syntax

Also HubPress has an recommanded writing guide here: Recommended-Practices

AsciiDoc Quick Reference
item.dc:creator: Andreas Gehle
